translation: A monk then despised the gods, and they said, "What faults do we have in being kind and deceiving them?"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「汝等從今於天神處，不應供養亦勿欺倰。」
translation: The monks then cited this as a reason to tell the Buddha, who said, "From now on, you mustn't make offerings to the gods or deceive them."

source_sentence: 時有苾芻，後於餘處見羯吒布呾那，及摩登伽瞿利伽像即便打破。
translation: Some monks then saw the images of Kāṭapurīya and Mātaṅga-gorīya in another place and broke them.

translation: The householders then said, "This image of the celestial gods has no mental consciousness, so why would the noble one so easily destroy it?"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「汝等苾芻！

translation: You shouldn't disfigure the images of celestial beings."

source_sentence: 有諸苾芻隨處遊行，時彼路便右繞天廟，佛言：「苾芻不應右繞天廟。」
translation: When some monks were marching along, they went right around the celestial temple on the road, and the Buddha said, "Monks, you shouldn't go right around the celestial temple."

source_sentence: 遂即避路，便為棘刺之所傷損，佛言：「應取舊路。

translation: As it's said, the great world is two and a half journeys away, and the disciples are told to go to their personal teacher and guiding teacher three times a day to ask for instruction and explain their business, which the Buddha himself has made.

source_sentence: 彼諸弟子去親教師及軌範師有兩驛半，路遙時促，未審如何？」
translation: Those disciples travel two and a half ways to their teacher and guiding teacher, and the road is long and short, so I wonder what they do."

source_sentence: 佛言：「應半月就禮。

source_sentence: 若去師五俱盧舍，應七八日一去禮拜。
translation: If you go to a teacher for five rounds, you should go once every seven or eight days to pay homage.

source_sentence: 若一俱盧舍，每日一去。
translation: If he goes to one kuruṣa, he should go once a day.

source_sentence: 若更相近乃至同處，應每日三時而為禮敬。
translation: If they're closer together or even in the same place, they should venerate them three times a day.

source_sentence: 若異此者得越法罪。」
translation: If someone differs from this, they'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 時鄔波難陀無鉢度人，時諸苾芻各洗鉢已安置龕中，請白二師旋遶制底。
translation: When Upananda had no bowl to deliver his disciples, the monks each washed his bowl, placed it in the niche, and asked the two masters to circumambulate him.

source_sentence: 鄔波難陀所度弟子有緣須鉢，便往尊者憍陳如鉢邊欲取其鉢，尊者告曰：「此是我鉢，汝不須觸。」
translation: When one of Upananda's disciples who had been saved by him had a need for a bowl, he went to Venerable Tathāgata's bowl and wanted to take his bowl, but he told him, "This is my bowl; you don't need to touch it."

source_sentence: 時彼復往餘人鉢處，同前欲取，還復見遮。
translation: He then went back to the others' bowls, tried to take them as before, and returned to see Caitra.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻問曰：「誰是汝師？」
translation: The bhikṣus then asked, "Who's your teacher?"

source_sentence: 彼便答言：「鄔波難陀。」
translation: They then replied, "Upananda!"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「不應無鉢度他出家及與近圓，得惡作罪。
translation: The monks then brought the matter to the Buddha's attention, and he said, "You shouldn't leave home without a bowl and go near and complete others, for that would be a misdeed.

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 凡欲度人出家為求寂者，應與鉢及小鉢并以銅椀，無令廢闕。」
translation: Anyone who wants to save someone from leaving home in order to pursue quiescence should give them a bowl, a small bowl, and a brass bowl, so they don't lose them."

source_sentence: 時阿尼盧馱有一弟子為師掌鉢，師與弟子鉢形相似，彼不能識，遂生疑曰：「為是師鉢、為我鉢耶？」
translation: A disciple of Aniruddha's was holding his master's bowl, and he couldn't recognize the resemblance between the master's bowl and the disciple's bowl, so he had this doubt, "Is this the master's bowl or my bowl?"

source_sentence: 時彼即便於其鉢底，各書名字。
translation: Even then, they each wrote their name on the bottom of their bowl.

source_sentence: 有一長者，奉請世尊及苾芻眾，就家受食。
translation: There was an elderly man who invited the Bhagavān and a congregation of monks to his home to receive a meal.

source_sentence: 長者先與婬女有私通事，遂遣使人報婬女曰：「我於今日請佛及僧，明日就家謹設供養，汝可來此手自奉食。」
translation: The elder had an illicit relationship with the woman, so he sent a messenger to the woman, telling her, "Today, I'll invite the Buddha and the saṃgha to my home tomorrow and make offerings, so you can come here and serve yourself food."

source_sentence: 是時婬女遇有他緣，不及親往。
translation: The promiscuous woman then had other reasons and couldn't go in person.

source_sentence: 佛及僧伽至時赴請，餅食已訖，說施伽他從座而去。
translation: When the Buddha and the saṃgha arrived, they invited them, finished their meal of bread, said "Give it to the monks," and departed from their seats.

source_sentence: 時彼長者是阿尼盧馱弟子知識，佛僧去已，唯彼弟子未出其舍，是時長者白言：「大德！
translation: That elder was a friend of Aniruddha's disciple, and after the Buddha and saṃgha left, only his disciple hadn't left his house.

source_sentence: 願以此鉢暫時相借，以所餘食欲寄與人。」
translation: Would you like to borrow this bowl for a while and give someone the rest of your food?"

source_sentence: 苾芻即以師鉢與之。
translation: The monk then gave him the master's bowl.

translation: The elder filled his bowl with fragrant foods and sent it to the young woman with the words, "Good man!

translation: I've asked the Three Treasures to present this food, and after the Buddha and Saṃgha have eaten it, you may rejoice."

source_sentence: 是時婬女既得鉢食，置餘器中，便於鉢底見尊者字，知是聖者阿尼盧馱所用之鉢，便作是念：「阿遮利耶乃見人天之所供養，我今有幸得見彼鉢，若我空然而送還者失大福利，事不應爾。」
translation: After she had received the bowl of food and placed it in a dish, the promiscuous woman saw the word Venerable at the bottom of the bowl and knew it was the bowl used by the sage Aniruddha. translation: He then took his bowl, cleaned it thoroughly, washed it again and again with scented bath, smeared it with scented clay, placed it on a marvelous pedestal, knelt on his right knee, held a wonderful flower garland in reverence, made offerings, burned incense, smoked it thoroughly, and vowed to stay there.

source_sentence: 我於此鉢略申供養。」

translation: After the monks heard this, they brought it to the Buddha's attention, and he said, "Such is the fault of monks who write their names on their belongings; therefore, they shouldn't write their names."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻不知何物是不應書？
translation: The monks didn't know what things they shouldn't write about.

source_sentence: 佛言：「有五種物皆不應書：謂別解脫戒經、別解脫廣釋、及諸事等、與律教相應之義，并私己物，於己物上不應書字，可作私記憶持。」
translation: The Buddha said, "There are five things that you shouldn't write on, namely, the sutras of the precepts of individual liberation, the extensive explanation of individual liberation, and various matters that are related to the teachings of the Vinaya, as well as your own personal belongings, on which you shouldn't write words that can be memorized privately."

translation: If the vinaya and other teachings are not written, how much more will such things be in the future, when the minds of the bhikṣus and others lack the strength to maintain them and are often forgetful and unable to recall dependent arising?"

translation: May I see your bowl and give it to you, and I will wash it."

translation: Śāriputra said, "The Buddha has made a training site for damaging the bowl."

source_sentence: 彼便白言：「我豈當作如斯過耶？」

translation: The monks then brought this to the Buddha's attention, and he said, "If you know that you can protect it when you seek peace, you'll allow them to wash their bowls."

source_sentence: 時有苾芻守持鐵鉢，垢生損壞多有孔隙，以緣白佛，佛言：「凡畜鐵鉢應可熟燒。」
translation: A monk then guarded an iron bowl that was soiled and damaged that it had many holes in it, and he brought it to the Buddha's attention, saying, "An iron bowl that's used for domestic purposes should be cooked and burned."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻多積柴薪而燒其鉢，即便損破，佛言：「不應如是火燒其鉢，可於籠內安置燒之。」
translation: Those monks then accumulated much firewood and burned their bowls, and even though they were damaged, the Buddha said, "You shouldn't burn your bowls like that; you can put them in a cage and burn them."

source_sentence: 彼便不知云何作籠？
translation: They then didn't know how to make a cage.

source_sentence: 佛言：「籠有二種：一者匠作，二者自為。
translation: The Buddha said, "There are two kinds of cages: those made by a smith and those made by oneself.

source_sentence: 言匠作者，謂是陶師。
translation: The term "maker" refers to a potter.

source_sentence: 言自作者，或時以瓮，或可用瓨截破用之。」
translation: When it's self-made, sometimes a pot may be used, or it may be used by cutting it with a metal."

source_sentence: 彼安在地打著便碎，佛言：「盛灰令滿使人擎持，然後以釘徐徐疎孔鑿為兩段。」
translation: When it hits the ground and breaks apart, the Buddha says, "Fill it with ashes and make it full for someone to carry, then slowly cut the hole with a nail and cut it into two pieces."

source_sentence: 時彼於外不以泥塗，佛言：「應以草[麥*弋]作泥遍塗。」
translation: When he doesn't rub mud on the outside, the Buddha says, "You should use straw [wheat*egg] to make mud and rub it all over."

source_sentence: 彼不以物塗拭於內，佛言：「應以麻滓作泥塗拭待乾。」
translation: When they didn't rub something on the inside, the Buddha said, "You should rub mud with hemp residue until it dries."

source_sentence: 然所燒鉢猶未受色，佛言：「內安稻[麥*弋]以籠合之口邊泥塗。」
translation: Still, the burnt bowl hadn't yet received its color, so the Buddha said, "Put rice [wheat*egg] inside and rub it with mud around the mouth of the cage."

source_sentence: 彼便以鉢置地而熏，佛言：「應用物支，於上重安事亦同此。」
translation: They then put the bowl on the ground and smoked it, and the Buddha said, "This is the same thing as applying sticks to things and re-setting them on top."

source_sentence: 彼物薄小鉢便相著，佛言：「應可高支勿令相近。」
translation: They then put a small bowl on top of something thin, and the Buddha said, "You should put it up high and not let it come near you."

source_sentence: 仍不受色，佛言：「應數數洗然後更燒。」
translation: Still not accepting the color, the Buddha said, "You should wash it several times and then burn it again."

source_sentence: 籠內煙出，佛言：「應灰擁口。」
translation: When smoke escapes from the cage, the Buddha says, "Ashes should be put in your mouth."

source_sentence: 彼以牛糞積為大聚燒便損鉢，佛言：「應壘牛糞從上放火。」
translation: When he made a large pile of cow dung and burned it, it damaged his bowl, and the Buddha said, "You should put the cow dung on fire from above."

source_sentence: 不知欲遣何人看火？
translation: I wonder who he wants to send to watch the fire?

source_sentence: 佛言：「苾芻應自看守，若有別緣囑餘苾芻看，然後應去。」
translation: The Buddha said, "A monk should guard it himself, and if he asks another monk to guard it for another reason, then he should leave."

source_sentence: 地上燒鉢多損諸蟲，佛言：「應淨灑掃。
translation: Burning a bowl on the ground often damages bugs, and the Buddha said, "It should be cleaned and swept away.

source_sentence: 是故我今聽諸苾芻畜熏鉢籠，及隨此籠所須之物用皆無犯。」
translation: Now, therefore, I've heard that it's no offense for monks to store smoked bowls and cages or to use the things needed for such cages."

source_sentence: 第三子攝頌曰：　一衣不互作，　　澡浴可遮人，　於褥不剃頭，　　病人隨服食。
translation: The third son gathered this verse, saying, "A single garment is not made for each other, a bath is provided to shelter people, the head is not shaved on a mat, and the sick are fed as they are.

translation: It was then that the Buddha was staying in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時有施主造立浴室奉施僧伽，六眾苾芻各著一裙互揩身體。
translation: A donor had built a bathhouse to serve the saṃgha, and six monks each wore a skirt to cleanse their bodies.

source_sentence: 俗人入見作如是語：「此等諸人是何外道？」
translation: When laypeople enter and see them, they say, "What kind of non-Buddhists are these people?"

source_sentence: 時敬信者答言：「是釋迦子。」
translation: The venerable replied, "It's Śākyamuni."

source_sentence: 居士聞已便起譏嫌：「彼之大師常有慚愧，云何此等無羞恥耶？」
translation: After hearing this, the householder then became critical, "That great teacher always had a sense of shame, so why is he so shameless?"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻聞以緣白佛，佛言：「不應一裙互相揩洗。
translation: When the monks heard this, they told the Buddha about it, and he said, "You shouldn't wash each other's skirts.

source_sentence: 若有犯者得惡作罪。」
translation: If you violate this rule, you'll commit a misdeed."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻在浴室內令俗人入，見苾芻等以手揩足復更摩頭，俗人譏曰：「沙門釋子作斯鄙法，是不淨潔，既揩足已復用摩頭。」
translation: When the monks were in the bathroom and allowed the seculars to enter, they saw the monks wiping their feet with their hands and rubbing their heads together, and the seculars criticized them, saying, "That's a despicable thing for an ascetic or a monk to do, which is impure, to wipe your feet and then rub your head together."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「入浴室時，無信敬人不應令入亦勿令作。
translation: The monks then told the Buddha about this, and he said, "When you enter the bath, a person without faith and respect shouldn't be allowed to enter or do it.

source_sentence: 若教作者得惡作罪。」
translation: If you teach someone to do that, you'll commit a misdeed."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻在浴室內無人守護，有諸居士來入其室，見苾芻等以手揩足復將洗面，便譏嫌曰：「沙門釋子實為鄙惡，以手揩足，復將洗面。」
translation: When the monks were in the bath without someone to guard them, some householders came into the room and saw the monks wiping their feet with their hands and preparing to wash their faces, and they criticized them, saying, "That ascetic and Śākyamuni really is despicable for wiping his feet with his hands and preparing to wash his face."

source_sentence: 佛言：「若洗浴時，無令俗人入浴室內，應差苾芻為守護者。」
translation: The Buddha said, "When you wash your body, don't let ordinary people enter the bathroom; send a monk to be the guard."

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者，與一無敬信婆羅門往逝多林，苾芻見已報長者曰：「勿使此人入浴室內。」
translation: An orphaned man and a faithless brāhmaṇa went to Jeta's Grove, and when the monk saw them, he reported to the elder, "Don't let that person enter the bath."

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：「我有何過而見遮止？」
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "What's wrong with me that I should see this person stopped?"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「若知彼人有淨信者應許入室。」
translation: The monks then brought the matter to the Buddha's attention, and he said, "If you know that person has pure faith, you should allow them to enter the room."

source_sentence: 時有婆羅門入既被遮，見餘不障，婆羅門曰：「彼諸俗人皆許入室，何故於我而獨見遮？」
translation: When a brāhmaṇa who had been prevented from entering saw that the rest weren't obstructed, the brāhmaṇa said, "Those secular people are all allowed to enter the room, so why am I the only one who sees the obstruction?"

source_sentence: 苾芻報曰：「此已歸依受諸學處。」
translation: The monk replied, "I've taken refuge in these places of training."

source_sentence: 彼便答曰：「我亦歸依受其學處，願聽我入。」
translation: He then replied, "I also take refuge in those training places, and may I be allowed to enter them."

source_sentence: 報言：「可爾。」
translation: He replied, "Yes, that's right."

source_sentence: 便與受戒即許其入。
translation: He then gave them the precepts and allowed them to enter.

source_sentence: 彼既入已，見諸苾芻揩身下分復用摩頭，遂起譏曰：「沙門釋子實為鄙穢。」
translation: After he had entered, he saw the monks wiping their bodies and rubbing their heads together, and he got up and criticized them, saying, "Ascetics and Śākyamunis are really filthy."

source_sentence: 苾芻白佛，佛言：「若知其人久懷信者許入，若初信者勿聽。」
translation: The monk told the Buddha, and he said, "If you know this person has long harbored faith, allow him to enter; if he's a novice believer, don't listen."

source_sentence: 緣處同前。
translation: The place of reference was the same as before.

source_sentence: 時有長者請佛及僧入室洗浴，是時世尊將諸苾芻詣彼長者洗浴之處，見有苾芻與一苾芻揩摩身體。
translation: An elderly man then invited the Buddha and the saṃgha into his room to wash himself, and the Bhagavān then sent the monks and nuns to where the elderly man washed himself and saw a monk and a monk rubbing their bodies together.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝等見此苾芻與彼苾芻揩摩身不？」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Do you see this monk and that monk rubbing their bodies together?"

source_sentence: 白言：「已見。」
translation: He said, "I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛告苾芻：「其為揩者，是阿羅漢諸漏已盡。
translation: The Buddha told the monk, "That person who wipes is an arhat whose contaminants have ended.

source_sentence: 彼受揩者，是破戒人行罪惡法。
translation: Someone who takes the wipe is a person who breaks the precepts and does bad things.

source_sentence: 汝等當知！
translation: You should know!

source_sentence: 不應師子與彼野干而為給事。」
translation: The lion shouldn't serve that wild goose chase."

source_sentence: 緣處同前。
translation: The place of reference is the same as the previous one.

source_sentence: 有一長者，娶妻未久誕生一息。
translation: There was an elderly man who had married a wife not long before she gave birth to a child.

source_sentence: 年既長大，於善說法律而為出家，常求勝已尋義他方博學多聞，還來至此室羅伐城。
translation: When he was old enough, he left home because he spoke the Dharma well, and after often seeking to become better, he sought out the meaning of other places, becoming well-versed and knowledgeable, and returned to this city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 父聞子至，便詣其所共相問訊。
translation: When his father heard his son's arrival, he went to his place and exchanged greetings with him.

source_sentence: 是時苾芻即為其父略宣法要，勸歸三寶受五學處。
translation: The monk then briefly explained the essentials of the Dharma for his father and encouraged him to return to the Three Treasures and accept the five training places.

source_sentence: 後於異時，復為其父說七有事福業功德。
translation: At another time, he also explained seven things about the merits and virtues of good actions for his father.

source_sentence: 父聞子說深生敬信，作如是言：「尊者當知！
translation: Hearing what his son taught, the father became deeply respectful and faithful, saying, "Venerable, you should know!

source_sentence: 我今亦願作七有事福業功德。」
translation: Now, I also want to create seven meritorious actions."

source_sentence: 彼便答言：「可隨意作。」
translation: He then replied, "You can do as you like."

source_sentence: 父便問言：「先作何事？」
translation: The father then asked, "What should I do first?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「當為僧伽營理浴室。」
translation: He replied, "You will run a bathhouse for the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 聞已還家營理事畢，來報子曰：「尊者！
translation: After hearing this, he returned home and finished managing the business, then came to report to the son, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 當稱我名請佛及僧就舍澡洗。」
translation: You must call on my name and invite the Buddha and the saṃgha to bathe in the monastery."

source_sentence: 其子聞已，即詣佛所稱父名字，而為請佛。
translation: After his son heard this, he went to the Buddha, called his father by name, and invited him to be the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時彼長者發深信心，自為苾芻香油塗身，以米屑揩去。
translation: That elder then had a deep faith, anointed his body with scented oil for the monk, and wiped it off with scraps of rice.

source_sentence: 澡浴事畢，報其子曰：「我極疲勞為我塗背。」
translation: When he had finished bathing, he told his son, "I'm extremely tired, so rub my back."

source_sentence: 其子答曰：「世尊於此已制學處。」
translation: The son replied, "The Bhagavān has made this a place of training."

source_sentence: 父便問曰：「所制學處其事云何？」
translation: The father then asked, "What's the place of training that's been made?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「勿以師子供侍野干，故我不應而為執事。」
translation: He answered, "Don't think of the lion as a servant to Nāgasena; therefore, I shouldn't be his manager."

source_sentence: 父問子曰：「誰是師子？
translation: The father asked his son, "Who is the lion?

source_sentence: 誰為野干？」
translation: Who is Yagan?"

source_sentence: 子答父言：「我是師子，父是野干。」
translation: The son answered his father, "I'm the lion, and my father is Nāgasena."

source_sentence: 父曰：「斯為妙事，以我野干能生師子。」
translation: The father said, "This is a wonderful thing, because I, a wild man, can give rise to a teacher and a son."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「凡是父母於其子處能為難事荷負眾苦，假令父母是極破戒，其子亦應為作供侍。
translation: The monks then told the Buddha about this, and he said, "Where a father and mother can bear the burden of many hardships for their child, even if their father and mother are in extreme breach of the precepts, their son should make offerings to them.

source_sentence: 是故我聽於其五處縱極破戒應為供給，所謂父、母、親教師、軌範師及諸病人。」
translation: Therefore, I've heard that there are five places where even the most extreme violations of the precepts should be offered, namely, to fathers, mothers, relative teachers, role models, and patients."

source_sentence: 爾時佛在室羅伐城。
translation: It was then that the Buddha was in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 有一長者於阿蘭若處造立其舍，令諸苾芻隨緣乞食依此而住。
translation: An elderly man had built a dwelling in a forest, and he caused the beggars to follow the food they were begging for and live there.

source_sentence: 時乞食者鬚髮既長，詣長者處，長者見已問言：「聖者！
translation: When the beggar with long hair and beard went to the elder, the elder looked at him and asked, "Sage!

source_sentence: 何故鬚髮如是太長？」
translation: Why is the hair on your beard so long?"

source_sentence: 答言：「賢首！
translation: He replied, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 無淨髮人。」
translation: There's no one with pure hair."

source_sentence: 長者告曰：「我遣人來可令除髮。」
translation: The elder told him, "I'll send someone here to shave your hair."

source_sentence: 其剃髮人詣苾芻所，於臥褥上令彼剃髮。
translation: The hair-shaver went to the monk and asked him to shave his hair on his mattress.

source_sentence: 時彼長者作是思惟：「應觀尊者除髮以不？」
translation: The elder then thought, "Should I observe the venerable removing his hair?"

source_sentence: 即往蘭若苾芻住處，到已即於臥褥上坐，髮著其衣。
translation: He went to the monk's residence in Ranjan and sat down on his mat when he arrived, with his hair on his robe.

source_sentence: 長者還舍，其妻遂見衣上有髮，白言：「因何過彼剃髮人舍，令此衣上有其髮污。」
translation: When the man returned to his dwelling, his wife saw the hair on his robe and said, "Why did you go past that man's dwelling who shaved his hair and cause this robe to be stained with his hair?"

source_sentence: 長者思惟：「將非聖者於彼褥上而剃髮耶？」
translation: The elder thought, "Could it be that a sage didn't shave his hair on that mat?"

source_sentence: 即重往觀，見其褥上有剃髮處，白言：「大德！
translation: He went back to look at it and saw a place on his mattress where his hair had been shaved and said, "Maestro!

source_sentence: 可於餘處剃髮，勿令污褥。」
translation: You may shave your hair elsewhere; don't let it stain the mat."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻聞已白佛，佛言：「不應褥上而剃鬚髮。」
translation: After the monks heard this, they said to the Buddha, "You shouldn't shave your hair on a mat."

source_sentence: 便於淨地剃除鬚髮，佛言：「凡是僧伽灑掃淨地不應剃髮，若有犯者得惡作罪。」
translation: They then shaved their hair on a pure spot. The Buddha said, "Suppose you shave your hair on a pure spot in the saṃgha and don't shave it there; if you do, you'll commit a misdeed."

source_sentence: 時有老病苾芻，不能出外剃髮，復遭風雨，佛言：「若無力者隨處剃除，然應掃除塗拭令淨，若不爾者得惡作罪。」
translation: When a sick or elderly monk was unable to go out to shave his hair and was again exposed to a storm, the Buddha said, "If he lacks the strength, he should shave it off anywhere, but he should sweep it off and wipe it clean; if he doesn't, he'll commit a misdeed."

source_sentence: 又諸苾芻剪手足甲，隨處棄擲，佛言：「僧伽淨地若棄爪甲，得惡作罪。」
translation: Furthermore, when some monks cut their fingernails and throw them away anywhere, the Buddha says, "If you throw away your fingernails in the pure land of the saṃgha, you'll commit a misdeed."

translation: The Bhagavān has instructed us not to eat at ungodly hours."

translation: Taking this as cause, he told the Buddha, "A toothless cow eats chaff and wheat, and then it comes out with all its grains intact; use this as bread at a time when it's not appropriate to take it."

source_sentence: 先時所苦得瘳損不？」
translation: Will you be able to heal what you've suffered in the past?"

source_sentence: 醫人曰：「豈非聖者未服水麨令病不差。」
translation: The doctor said, "Could it be that the noble man hasn't taken water and bread to keep his illness from getting worse?"

source_sentence: 苾芻答曰：「我已服竟。」
translation: The monk replied, "I've finished taking it."

source_sentence: 醫曰：「當如何服？」
translation: The doctor said, "How should I take it?"

source_sentence: 時病苾芻具以事告，醫言：「聖者！
translation: The sick monk then gave a full account of the incident, and the doctor said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 此非是藥，應用生麥麨。」
translation: This is not medicine; it should be taken with raw wheat flour."

translation: He told the Buddha about this, and he said, "Stir much water into it, strain it with something, and then you should take it."

translation: Still sick, he again told the doctor about this, and he replied, "Don't strain it and take it."

source_sentence: 以緣白佛，佛言：「醫人處方令服麨飲，若稠若團隨意應服。」
translation: He took this as a reason to tell the Buddha, and he said, "The doctor prescribes that he serve bread and drink it, whether it's thick or lumpy, as he wishes."

translation: The monk brought this to the Buddha's attention, and he said, "There's an animal named Mudgata that eats flesh straight from its intestines and then exits, but its body has yet to change.

translation: Even though he did take it, the doctor asked, "Sage!

source_sentence: 所苦得除損不？」
translation: Will the suffering be removed?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「未損。」
translation: He replied, "It hasn't hurt yet."

source_sentence: 醫曰：「豈可聖者未服肉汁令斯疾病而無損耶？」
translation: The doctor said, "Could a sage not have taken the gravy and still be unhurt?"

source_sentence: 苾芻具答其事，醫言：「聖者！
translation: The bhikṣu answered all of these things and the doctor said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 此是故物不堪為藥，應取新肉煮而飲汁。」
translation: This is an old thing that can't be used as medicine; you should boil new flesh and drink the juice."

source_sentence: 白佛，佛言：「先以物濾然後飲之。」
translation: He said to the Buddha, "First strain it and then drink it."

source_sentence: 病猶不差，彼以此事告彼醫人，醫人答言：「勿濾而服。」
translation: Still sick, he told the doctor about it, and he replied, "Don't strain it and take it."

source_sentence: 以緣白佛，佛言：「醫人處方隨意應服，若乾若濕令有氣味，皆應服食，勿生疑慮。」
translation: Taking this as a reason, he told the Buddha, "The doctor will give it to you as he sees fit, and if it's dry or wet and has an odor, you should take it and not have any doubts."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「凡所有事，我於病人非時開者，於病差後咸不應作。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Whatever I tell a patient at an inappropriate time, I shouldn't do it after he gets sick.

source_sentence: 若有作者，得越法罪。」
translation: If I do, I'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."
